intro: Solanum bigeminatum, commonly known as the twin-fruited nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, and its fruits are typically two-seeded berries that mature to a deep red color. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and its ability to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and research settings.
